channel.title: What do I need to learn in order to become an artificial intelligence researcher? logic + philosophy + arts
channel.description:
originally [written on quora](https://www.quora.com/What-do-I-need-to-learn-in-order-to-research-artificial-intelligence/answer/Caue-Rego) yet another "self help" thought:
[quote] scientifically I'd say you could think of Ai with 3 axis: _logic_, _philosophy_ and _arts_.
_(if this answer gets enough interest I'll expand more)_
**logic** that's the binary world, the same one that constructs math and progamming*. you can't have any kind of intelligence without a solid logic.
**philosophy** this is the spiritual world, looked upon mostly through logic (i.e. with much intelligence).
**arts** materialization. Ai is a lot about ideas but nothing of that matters if you can't bring it to the real world. making a spam filter out of pure logic is an awesome piece art and, make no mistake, programming is a form of art! ;)
---
there really is nothing in your life you can't use to learn about researching for Ai, specially if you're talking about the tech singularity. **anything works**.
now, if all you want is weak Ai, the one being sold today, you can leave **philosophy** behind and focus most your efforts in **logic** and, if you're lucky enough, make tons of money with it, with a good enough **art**. just keep in mind money isn't everything - it's just 1/3 of it. [/quote]
